org.hackystat.sensorshell
Class SensorShell

java.lang.Object
  org.hackystat.sensorshell.SensorShell

public class SensorShell
extends java.lang.Object

Provides "middleware" for accumulating and sending notification (sensor) data to Hackystat. SensorShell has two modes of interaction: command line and programmatic.

Command line mode is entered by invoking the main() method, and is intended to be used as a kind of subshell to which commands to add and send notification data of various types can be sent. The SensorShell can be invoked without any additional arguments as follows: 

java -jar sensorshell.jar
Or you can invoke it with one, two, three, or four additional arguments: 
java -jar sensorshell.jar [toolname] [sensor.properties] [no offline] [command file]

Programmatic mode involves creating an instance of SensorShell, retrieving the appropriate command instance (Ping, Add, etc.) and invoking the appropriate method.

Author:
Philip M. Johnson

Constructor Detail

SensorShell

public SensorShell(SensorProperties sensorProperties,
                   boolean isInteractive)
Constructs a new SensorShell instance that can be provided with notification data to be sent eventually to a specific user key and host. The toolName field in the log file name is set to "interactive" if the tool is invoked interactively and "tool" if it is invoked programmatically.

Parameters:
sensorProperties - The sensor properties instance for this run.
isInteractive - Whether this SensorShell is being interactively invoked or not.

SensorShell

public SensorShell(SensorProperties sensorProperties,
                   boolean isInteractive,
                   java.lang.String toolName)
Constructs a new SensorShell instance that can be provided with notification data to be sent eventually to a specific user key and host.

Parameters:
sensorProperties - The sensor properties instance for this run.
isInteractive - Whether this SensorShell is being interactively invoked or not.
toolName - Indicates the invoking tool that is added to the log file name.

SensorShell

public SensorShell(SensorProperties sensorProperties,
                   boolean isInteractive,
                   java.lang.String toolName,
                   boolean enableOfflineData,
                   java.io.File commandFile)
Constructs a new SensorShell instance that can be provided with notification data to be sent eventually to a specific user key and host. (For testing purposes only, you may want to disable offline data recovery.)

Parameters:
sensorProperties - The sensor properties instance for this run.
isInteractive - Whether this SensorShell is being interactively invoked or not.
toolName - The invoking tool that is added to the log file name.
enableOfflineData - A boolean indicating whether to recover and/or store offline data.
commandFile - A file containing shell commands, or null if none provided.

isInteractive - Whether this SensorShell is being interactively invoked or not.
toolName - The invoking tool that is added to the log file name.
enableOfflineData - A boolean indicating whether to recover and/or store offline data.
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The command line shell interface.
  • If invoked with no arguments, then the default sensor.properties file is used and the toolName field in the sensor log file name is "interactive".
  • If invoked with one argument, that argument is used as the toolName value.
  • If invoked with two arguments, then the first argument is used as the toolName value and the second is used as the sensor.properties file path.
  • If invoked with three arguments, then the first argument is the toolname, the second is the sensor.properties file path, and the third argument (regardless of value) disables offline data management.
  • If invoked with four arguments, then the first argument is the toolname, the second is the sensor.properties file path, the third argument (regardless of value) disables offline data management, and the fourth argument specifies a file of commands (the last of which should be 'quit').
Unless four arguments are provided, the shell then provides a ">>" prompt and supports interactive entry of sensor data. The following commands are supported:
  • "help" provides a summary of the available commands.
  • "send" sends all of the accumulated data to the server.
  • "autosend" sets up a timer-based process that invokes send intermittently.
  • "quit" sends all of the accumulated data to the server and exits.
  • "ping" checks to see if the host/user/password is valid.
  • "add" adds a single Sensor Data instance to the buffered list to send.

Parameters:
args - The command line parameters. See above for details.

println

public final void println(java.lang.String line)
Prints out the line plus newline if in interactive mode, and always logs the line. Provided to clients to support logging of error messages.

Parameters:
line - The line to be printed.

isInteractive

public boolean isInteractive()
Returns true if this sensorshell is being run interactively from the command line.

Returns:
True if sensorshell is interactive.

getLogger

public java.util.logging.Logger getLogger()
Returns the Logger associated with this sensorshell.

Returns:
The Logger.

enableOfflineData

public boolean enableOfflineData()
Returns true if offline data saving is enabled.

Returns:
True if offline data is enabled.

add

public void add(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> keyValMap)
         throws java.lang.Exception
Converts the values in the KeyValMap to a SensorData instance and adds it to the shell. This is the easiest way to add sensor data. The Owner will default to the hackystat user in the sensor.properties file. The Timestamp and Runtime will default to the current time.

Parameters:
keyValMap - The map of key-value pairs.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If the Map cannot be translated into SensorData, typically because a value was passed for Timestamp or Runtime that could not be parsed into XMLGregorianCalendar.

send

public void send()
Sends any accumulated SensorData instances to the Server.

quit

public void quit()
Shuts down this SensorShell, sending any unsent data and closing log files.

ping

public boolean ping()
Returns true if the host can be pinged and the email/password combination is valid.

Returns:
True if the host can be pinged and the user credentials are valid.

setAutoSend

public void setAutoSend(int minutes)
Sets the autosend interval to minutes. If minutes is 0, then autosending is disabled.

Parameters:
minutes - The interval in minutes for autosending.
